result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

records.addlTxt:
10:12 AM Defendant Kristy L. Mehalek in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman appeared by video for Kristy L. Mehalek.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and appearances. Waived reading. Set for preliminary hearing. Waived time limits. Bond to continue.
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Waiver of Prelim on November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:47 AM Defendant Kristy L. Mehalek in court.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Atty Thomas-Schmidt appears with the defendant specially. PD's office has not found attorney for the defendant at this time. Adjournment requested. No objections from the state. Bond to continue.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

NO ABUSIVE CONTACT WITH ALLEGED VICTIMS DOB: 06-23-19 AND DOB: 06-19-2016
NOT TO POSSESS OR CONSUME ANY ALCOHOL
NOT TO ENTER AN ESTABLISHMENT THAT SELLS ALCOHOL FOR PRIMARY CONSUMPTION
NOT TO POSSESS OR CONSUME ANY CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES WITHOUT A VALID PRESCRIPTION BY A LICENSED PHYSICIAN
NOT TO ASSOCIATE WITH INDIVIDUALS KNOWN TO USE SUBSTANCES

Defendant Kristy L. Mehalek in court.  Attorney Stephanie Thomas-Schmidt appears by video for Defendant Kristy L. Mehalek. Attorney Christian J Ness appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 

1:16 PM Court recites case and appearances. Attorney Thomas-Schmidt is making a special appearance for defendant as she does qualify for their services. Attorney Thomas-Schmidt makes statement re: reason for defendant's missed appearance. Court questions defendant. Defendant makes statement.

Attorney Ness makes recommendation for bond - $2,500.00 signature bond. Attorney Thomas-Schmidt does not object. Court quashes warrant. Court orders $2,500.00 signature bond.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Voluntary appearance on August 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:53 AM Defendant Kristy L. Mehalek not in court.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. No appearance by defendant. State speaks re: service-requests warrant.
Initial appearance on August 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
